headline.main: PREMIER HITS OUT; Denounces Critics While Revealing the Loss of 50,000 Men in Desert. SAYS CRISIS MAY BE GREAT Churchill Declares Message of 'Grave Importance' May Come -- New Axis Move Looked For CHURCHILL HITS OUT AND WINS BIG VOTE

lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 2 -- The House of Commons gave Prime Minister Winston Churchill a fresh mandate today to continue the direction of the war both as Prime Minister and Minister of Defense. By a vote of 475 to 25, with about twenty-seven members abstaining, the first motion of censure that Mr. Churchill had had to face since he became head of the British Government in May, 1940, was defeated.

keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST FRONT
